etymology.description: 外(outside) + 卖(sell) = sell to the outside; takeout/delivery.
etymology.interpretation: Indicates goods—especially meals—sold for off‑premise consumption or delivery. In modern Mandarin, commonly refers to restaurant takeout and app-based delivery.
etymology.simplification: Only 賣→卖 changed: the 貝 component was dropped to reduce strokes, following the general simplification of 貝-series characters, so 外賣 → 外卖.

examples.chinese: 我们点了外卖(我們點了外賣)。
这家店只做外卖(這家店只做外賣)，不提供堂食(不提供堂食)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā diàn zhǐ zuò wàimài, bù tígōng tángshí.
examples.english: This shop only does takeout and doesn’t offer dine-in.

examples.chinese: 外卖小哥已经到楼下(外賣小哥已經到樓下)，请下去取餐(請下去取餐)。
examples.pinyin: Wàimài xiǎogē yǐjīng dào lóuxià, qǐng xiàqù qǔ cān.
examples.english: The delivery rider has arrived downstairs; please go down to pick up the food.
